captions.hook: that feeling in your chest that won't go away
captions.value:
anxiety doesn't always have a reason. sometimes it's just there ‚Äî heavy, constant, unexplainable.

you're not crazy for feeling anxious about nothing. your nervous system is stuck in alarm mode. that can change
captions.cta: if you felt this today, you're not alone ü§ç

captions.hook: worrying about things that haven't happened and probably never will
captions.value:
your brain is trying to protect you by running worst-case scenarios 24/7. it means well but it's exhausting.

next time anxiety hits, try naming 5 things you can see right now. it sounds simple but it pulls your brain back to the present
captions.cta: save this for your next anxious moment

captions.hook: "what if something goes wrong" on repeat forever
captions.value:
anxiety is your brain's smoke alarm going off when there's no fire. it's not lying ‚Äî it genuinely believes there's danger.

the goal isn't to silence it. it's to gently show it that right now, in this moment, you're safe
captions.cta: anyone else's brain never turns off? comment üß†

captions.hook: everyone thinks you're fine. inside you're falling apart
captions.value:
high-functioning anxiety is real. you show up, perform, smile ‚Äî and nobody sees the storm underneath.

being good at coping doesn't mean you're okay. it means you've been surviving for so long you forgot what thriving feels like
captions.cta: share this with someone who always seems "fine"

captions.hook: anxiety picked your outfit, your route to work, and your mood today
captions.value:
when anxiety runs your life, every decision becomes a negotiation with fear. should i go? what if they judge me? what if something bad happens?

freedom starts with one choice anxiety didn't approve of. just one
captions.cta: what does anxiety control in your life? drop it below
